it.unitn.ing.rista.diffr
Class Geometry

java.lang.Object
  it.unitn.ing.rista.interfaces.BaseFactoryObject
      it.unitn.ing.rista.diffr.XRDcat
          it.unitn.ing.rista.diffr.Geometry
All Implemented Interfaces:
basicObj, java.lang.Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
GeometryDiffractometer
public class Geometry
extends XRDcat

The Geometry is a class to performs computation specific for the geometry of a goniometer. Different goniometer geometries should overwrite and implements the methods of this class. This class is never instantiated. It is mere like an interface object to specify and implements the basic methods and funtionalities.

Since:
JDK1.1

Method Detail

getAngularCalibration

public AngularCalibration getAngularCalibration()
Return the AngularCalibration object. Convenient method. It asks to the instrument (the parent) to return the actual AngularCalibration.

getDetector

public Detector getDetector()
Return the Detector object. Convenient method. It asks to the instrument (the parent) to return the actual Detector.

getThetaDetector

public float getThetaDetector(DiffrDataFile datafile,
                              double position)
Return the theta value of the detector position. Convenient method.

Parameters:
datafile - the spectrum for which the position is required
position - the peak or point position in the spectrum. For example for TOF, the theta position of the detector is returned.

getEtaDetector

public float getEtaDetector(DiffrDataFile datafile,
                            double position)
Return the eta value of the detector position. Convenient method.

Parameters:
datafile - the spectrum for which the position is required
position - the peak or point position in the spectrum. For example for TOF, the eta position of the detector is returned.

getMeasurement

public Measurement getMeasurement()
Return the Measurement object. Convenient method. It asks to the instrument (the parent) to return the actual Measurement.

getRadius

public double getRadius(DiffrDataFile datafile)
Return the goniometer radius. Actually this return just the default radius. Subclasses must override this method to return the radius value obtained from the list of parameters or from a field object. This class is never instantiated, so doesn't provide parameters or others fields.

getTextureAngles

public float[] getTextureAngles(DiffrDataFile datafile,
                                float[] tilting_angles,
                                float[] sampleAngles,
                                float twotheta)
Return an array of two floats containing the azimuthal and polar angles in pole figure coordinates for texture analysis. The angles are computed for a specific position of a peak in a spectrum collected at a certain orientation and the sample positioned at a specific orientation. The following is the general method. Subclasses of Geometry that need a specific different way to compute the pole figure angles need to overwrite this method.

Parameters:
datafile - the spectrum or datafile for which the angles should be computed
tilting_angles - array containing omega, chi, phi and eta for the spectrum in the insturment coordinates
sampleAngles - array containing omega, chi and phi angular position of the sample
twotheta - the 2-theta or d-spacing (if the spectrum is in d-spacing) of the peak for which the angles should be computed.

getTrueTiltingAngles

public float[] getTrueTiltingAngles(DiffrDataFile datafile,
                                    float[] tilting_angles,
                                    float position)
Return an array of floats with the angles in the Instrument convention as omega, chi, phi, and eta. Non transformed in texture coordinates.

Parameters:
datafile - the relative spectrum
tilting_angles - the angles at which the spectrum was collected in Instrument convention.
position - the point or peak position in the spectrum (d-space or 2theta coordinates).

getPathK

public double getPathK(double position,
                       boolean dspacingbase,
                       float[] tilting_angles)
Return the correction for path absorption in layered system. Should be rewrite to be consistent with the new program structure. Deprecated, please don't use it.

Parameters:
position - the point or peak position in the spectrum (d-space or 2theta coordinates).
dspacingbase - true if position in d-spacing, false if in 2theta
tilting_angles - the angles at which the spectrum was collected in Instrument convention.

getTextureAngles

public float[] getTextureAngles(float tilting_angles0,
                                float tilting_angles1,
                                float tilting_angles2,
                                float tilting_angles3,
                                float thetaAng,
                                float[] sampleAngles,
                                boolean planeProjection)
Return an array of two floats containing the azimuthal and polar angles in pole figure coordinates for texture analysis. The method performs the angles transformation and it is called by the omonymous method.

Parameters:
tilting_angles0 - Omega angle of the spectrum in instrument coordinates
tilting_angles1 - Chi angle of the spectrum
tilting_angles2 - Phi angle of the spectrum
tilting_angles3 - omega angle of the spectrum
thetaAng - position in the theta circle, 0 if in d-spacing
sampleAngles - array containing omega, chi and phi angular position of the sample

getTextureAnglesR

public float[] getTextureAnglesR(float tilting_angles0,
                                 float tilting_angles1,
                                 float tilting_angles2,
                                 float tilting_angles3,
                                 float thetaAng,
                                 float[] sampleAngles,
                                 boolean planeProjection)
Return an array of two floats containing the azimuthal and polar angles in pole figure coordinates for texture analysis. The method performs the angles transformation and it is called by the omonymous method.

Parameters:
tilting_angles0 - Omega angle of the spectrum in instrument coordinates
tilting_angles1 - Chi angle of the spectrum
tilting_angles2 - Phi angle of the spectrum
tilting_angles3 - omega angle of the spectrum
thetaAng - position in the theta circle, 0 if in d-spacing
sampleAngles - array containing omega, chi and phi angular position of the sample

computeActiveTextureAngles

public void computeActiveTextureAngles(float[][] tilting_angles,
                                       float[] sampleAngles,
                                       float position)
Alternative method to getTextureAngles; to speed up the computation instead of calling the getTextureAngles method for each peak in a datafile, a matrix of angles can be used. The first index refers to which angle (omega, chi, phi and eta) and the second to the spectrum number in the dataset. The evaluation is done for the same peak or reflection in the same dataset (same instrument). So position, either in 2theta or d-space is always the same.

Parameters:
tilting_angles - matrix for angles, first index refers to the different angles, second index to the spectrum or different point.
sampleAngles - array containing omega, chi and phi angular position of the sample
position - the 2-theta or d-spacing (if the spectrum is in d-spacing) of the peak for which the angles should be computed. The angles are putted in the tilting_angles matrix on [0][index] and [1][index] elements for the azimuthal and polar angles.

computeTextureAngles

public void computeTextureAngles(float[][] tilting_angles,
                                 float[] sampleAngles,
                                 float position)
Called by computeActiveTextureAngles, this is the pure Java implementation of routine to do the angle conversion.

Parameters:
tilting_angles - matrix for angles, first index refers to the different angles, second index to the spectrum or different point.
sampleAngles - array containing omega, chi and phi angular position of the sample
position - the 2-theta or d-spacing (if the spectrum is in d-spacing) of the peak for which the angles should be computed. The angles are putted in the tilting_angles matrix on [0][index] and [1][index] elements for the azimuthal and polar angles.

getIncidentAndDiffractionAngles

public float[][] getIncidentAndDiffractionAngles(DiffrDataFile datafile,
                                                 float[] tilting_angles,
                                                 float[] sampleAngles,
                                                 float[] position)
Return an array of two floats containing the azimuthal and polar angles in pole figure coordinates for the incident and diffracted beam. To be used, for example, for absorption correction.

Parameters:
datafile - the spectrum or datafile for which the angles should be computed
tilting_angles - angles at which the spectrum was collected in the instrument coordinates.
sampleAngles - array containing omega, chi and phi angular position of the sample
position - the 2-theta or d-spacing (if the spectrum is in d-spacing) of the peak for which the angles should be computed. The angles are putted in the tilting_angles matrix on [0][index] and [1][index] elements for the azimuthal and polar angles.

getTextureAngles

public float[] getTextureAngles(float[] tilting_angles,
                                float twotheta)

LorentzPolarization

public double LorentzPolarization(DiffrDataFile adatafile,
                                  Sample asample,
                                  double position,
                                  boolean dspacingbase)
Return the Lorentz-Polarization factor.

Parameters:
adatafile - the spectrum or datafile for which the factor must be computed.
asample - the sample object asking for the computation.
position - the 2-theta or d-spacing (if the spectrum is in d-spacing) of the point for which the correction should be computed.
dspacingbase - true if position is in d-space (Angstroms), false if 2theta The basic method here just return 1.0 always. Must be overwrited for other geometries. The dspacingbase actually should not be used, as its value should be equal to adatafile.dspacingbase

LorentzPolarization

public void LorentzPolarization(DiffrDataFile adatafile,
                                Sample asample,
                                float[] position,
                                boolean dspacingbase,
                                float[] intensity)
Compute the Lorentz-Polarization factor and return it as a multipler in the intensity array.

Parameters:
adatafile - the spectrum or datafile for which the factor must be computed.
asample - the sample object asking for the computation.
position - the 2-theta or d-spacing (if the spectrum is in d-spacing) of the point for which the correction should be computed.
dspacingbase - true if position is in d-space (Angstroms), false if 2theta
intensity - the array of intensities. In return the method give intensity *= LP The basic method here just return 1.0 always. Must be overwrited for other geometries. The dspacingbase actually should not be used, as its value should be equal to adatafile.dspacingbase

getBeamOutCorrection

public double getBeamOutCorrection(DiffrDataFile adatafile,
                                   Sample asample,
                                   double position)
Return the correction factor for the beam going out of the sample. Factor 1.0 means all the beam is inside.

Parameters:
adatafile - the spectrum or datafile for which the factor must be computed.
asample - the sample object asking for the computation.
position - the 2-theta or d-spacing (if the spectrum is in d-spacing) of the point for which the correction should be computed. The basic method here just return 1.0 always. Must be overwrited for other geometries.

computeShapeAbsorptionCorrection

public void computeShapeAbsorptionCorrection(DiffrDataFile adatafile,
                                             Sample asample,
                                             float[] position,
                                             boolean dspacingbase,
                                             float[] intensity,
                                             float toLambda)
Return the correction factor for the absorption by the sample.

Parameters:
adatafile - the spectrum or datafile for which the factor must be computed.
asample - the sample object asking for the computation.
position - the 2-theta or d-spacing (if the spectrum is in d-spacing) of the point for which the correction should be computed.
dspacingbase - true if position is in d-space (Angstroms), false if 2theta
intensity - the array of intensities. In return the method give intensity *= LP The basic method here just return 1.0 always. Must be overwrited for other geometries. The dspacingbase actually should not be used, as its value should be equal to adatafile.dspacingbase

getInstrumentalBroadeningAt

public double[] getInstrumentalBroadeningAt(double[] broad,
                                            double position,
                                            float[] tilting_angles,
                                            boolean dspacingbase)
Return the instrumental broadening for an equivalent Pseudo-Voigt function as an array of two values: HWHM and Gaussian content. The method is called by Instrument which already passes these values from its parameter. This method should modify the values only if a particular geometry requires it.

Parameters:
broad - the two broadening values.
position - the 2-theta or d-spacing (if the spectrum is in d-spacing) of the point for which the broadening should be computed.
tilting_angles - angles at which the spectrum was collected in the instrument coordinates.
dspacingbase - true if position is in d-space (Angstroms), false if 2theta The basic method here just return the same values always. In general should not be overwrited.

getInstrumentalAsymmetry

public double getInstrumentalAsymmetry(double asy,
                                       double position,
                                       float[] tilting_angles,
                                       boolean dspacingbase)
Return the instrumental asymmetry for the convolution with the profile function. The method here is called by Instrument and should not be modify in general.

Parameters:
asy - the actual value of the asymmetry.
position - the 2-theta or d-spacing (if the spectrum is in d-spacing) of the point for which the broadening should be computed.
tilting_angles - angles at which the spectrum was collected in the instrument coordinates.
dspacingbase - true if position is in d-space (Angstroms), false if 2theta

getCorrectedPosition

public double getCorrectedPosition(Sample asample,
                                   double position,
                                   float[] tilting_angles,
                                   DiffrDataFile adatafile)
Return the position of the peak corrected for position, aberration, instrumental errors. The basic method don't compute any correction and give back the same value.

Parameters:
asample - the sample for which should be computed.
position - the 2-theta or d-spacing (if the spectrum is in d-spacing) of the point for which the broadening should be computed.
tilting_angles - angles at which the spectrum was collected in the instrument coordinates.
adatafile - the spectrum or datafile for which the factor must be computed.

freeAllBasicParameters

public void freeAllBasicParameters()
Free all the parameters for a basic refine that could be refined here. Actually none for geometry.

getOptionsDialog

public JOptionsDialog getOptionsDialog(java.awt.Frame parent)
Instantiates and display the properties/options frame of this object.
